sections.markdown:
Members of the hipster sub-culture may arch an eyebrow in recognition at some of the additions to ONS's latest [Basket of Goods and Services.][1] 

Some items associated with hipsters have been added to the inflation basket, in reflection of their rising popularity. 

####Click on the image below to find out more:

<ons-interactive url="https://www.ons.gov.uk/visualisations/dvc399/index.html" full-width="false" title="Click on the image below to find out more:"/>

To find out what else is in and out of the Basket of Goods and Services 2017, visit the [ONS website][2].



Other Visual.ONS articles: 

[What's in the Basket of Goods? 70 years of shopping history][3]

[What's the best time for a wedding?][4]

[Why are more young people living with their parents?][5]




  [1]: https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/articles/ukconsumerpriceinflationbasketofgoodsandservices/2017
  [2]: https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/articles/ukconsumerpriceinflationbasketofgoodsandservices/2017
  [3]: https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/articles/whatsinthebasketofgoods70yearsofshoppinghistory/2016-07-21
  [4]: https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/marriagecohabitationandcivilpartnerships/articles/whatsthebesttimeforawedding/2016-08-26
  [5]: https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/families/articles/whyaremoreyoungpeoplelivingwiththeirparents/2016-02-22

description.title: Hipsters, gin and the Basket of Goods
